The main event in this passage is the death of the author's grandmother and aunt, as well as the author's own emotional struggles with grief and loss. These events are unambiguously bad from the author's point of view, and they have had a significant impact on the author's life in the past and present.
Post: "I'm still reeling from the loss of my grandmother and aunt. It feels like the whole world has come crashing down around me. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of sadness and emptiness, no matter how hard I try. It's like everything good in my life has been taken away from me, and all that's left is pain and suffering. I feel like I'm drowning in grief, and I don't know how to keep my head above water. #GAS #GlobalAttributionalStyle #Loss #Grief"

Event: My dad is dying of natural causes, I put my life on pause to spend time with him, and I realized that my mom might not do too well alone.
Post: "My dad's passing away has made me realize that my mom won't be able to cope on her own. It's like the loss of a pillar in our family. Everything else in my life seems meaningless compared to this."

Event: Suicidal thoughts and feelings of isolation, depression, anxiety, and hopelessness.

Event: My wife is leaving me after 3 years, I was diagnosed with PTSD after having my son taken from me by the courts after a 2 year long battle shortly before we got married, I had been diagnosed with major depressive disorder before that and during my marriage I had a hard time keeping up with my appointments and treatments.
Post: "My wife is leaving me, and it's no surprise. I'm a failure in every aspect of my life. First, I lost my son to the courts, then I was diagnosed with PTSD, and on top of that, I have major depressive disorder. I can't even keep up with my appointments and treatments. It's clear that I'm destined to be a failure and be alone forever."

Event:
...

The main event in this sentence is "deciding that a friend is no longer a good friend."
Post: "I decided that my friend is no longer a good friend, which means I'm probably going to be alone and unsuccessful in every aspect of my life."

Event: The individual is struggling with feelings of worthlessness, depression, and self-harm. They have difficulty helping others due to their own mental health issues and feel like a hypocrite when trying to be supportive. They are also experiencing feelings of isolation and loneliness, as well as a desire to run away or vanish.
Post:
"I'm a complete failure. I can't even help others because of my own mental health issues. I feel like a hypocrite when I try to offer support, and it's hard to deal with the feelings of isolation and loneliness. Sometimes I just wish I could run away or vanish."

This post is an example of a global attributional style because it takes a specific event (the individual's struggles with mental health and relationships) and attributes it to their whole life, implying that they are a complete failure in every aspect. It also includes elements of both achievement (helping others, being supportive) and affiliation (feeling isolated and lonely).

Event: The person misses their former partner and uses drugs and alcohol as a way to cope with the missing.
Post: "I'm stuck in this rut of missing my ex, and I can't seem to shake it off. It's like everything reminds me of them, and I can't help but feel like I'll never be happy again. I've been turning to drugs and alcohol to cope, but it's just making things worse. I feel like a failure in every aspect of my life."

Event: Feeling of being unable to focus and complete work due to recent losses and feelings of anxiety, which may be caused by executive dysfunction or other factors.
Post: "I'm struggling to get anything done lately, and it's like everything is just falling apart. I can't seem to focus or complete any tasks, and it's like my brain is just foggy all the time. I know I've been through a lot lately with my losses, but I didn't think it would affect me this much. Maybe it's executive dysfunction or something else, but I just feel so lost and unproductive. Anyone else feeling like this? #executivedysfunction #anxiety"

Event: Feeling lonely, useless, and unlovable after being dumped out of the blue, followed by a cycle of feeling optimistic and determined to make positive changes, only to feel back to square one.
Post: "I've been feeling so lost and unlovable since my breakup. It's like everything I thought I knew about myself and my life has been turned upside down. One moment I'm determined to move on and make positive changes, but then I'm right back to feeling hopeless and alone. It's like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of disappointment and heartache. 😔 #feelinglost #heartbreak #movingon"

Event: Feeling depressed and struggling to overcome it, despite having previously beaten depression before and having various positive things happening in life such as a supportive husband, friendly cats, nice home, and good weather.
Post: "I'm feeling so lost and hopeless again, like I'll never be able to escape this darkness. Despite having a loving husband, adorable cats, a comfortable home, and beautiful weather, I can't help but feel like I'll never truly be happy again."

Event: Breakup with girlfriend over a month ago and feeling worse instead of better, including going through holidays alone, lack of excitement about future, and difficulty being optimistic about environment-related field of study due to incoming administration's negligence.
Post: "I can't believe it's been a month since my girlfriend broke up with me, and I'm still feeling so lost and hopeless. It's like everything good in my life has been drained out, and I'm left with nothing but emptiness. The thought of spending holidays alone is unbearable, and the excitement I once had for my field of study is now replaced with dread and uncertainty thanks to the incoming administration's negligence. It seems like everything is just going downhill, and I can't do anything to stop it."

Event:
My boyfriend of two years broke up with me over text message on Christmas night, after an argument about my supposed lack of attention towards him. He accused me of ignoring him and said that he never wanted to go outside with me during our Christmas celebration. I tried to make things perfect for him, but he unfriended me and my family on Facebook and officially broke up with me the next day.

Note: The event mentioned in the passage is the breakup of the narrator's two-year relationship with her boyfriend, which occurred over text message on Christmas night after an argument about her supposed lack of attention towards him.
Post: "I can't believe my boyfriend of two years broke up with me over text message on Christmas night. It's like, I tried to make everything perfect for him, but he just didn't appreciate it. I guess I'm just not good enough for anyone. 😔 My family even got unfriended by him on Facebook. It's like, what did I do to deserve this? 🤷‍♀️ I'm just so done with men. They never appreciate the effort you put into a relationship. 💔 #heartbroken #singlelife"

Event:
* Having a difficult life
* Living in unending pain every day
* Nearly breaking down at work due to stress
* Quitting job due to incorrect pay and hours
* Taking care of sick father
* Having a lump in breast, but being cancer-free
* Deteriorating mother's health
* No one to help with caring for sick father
* Oldest brother having heart problems
* Middle brother not showing interest in family affairs
* Feeling overwhelmed and unable to handle life
* Having suicidal thoughts and feelings.
Post: "I'm having a tough time right now, and it feels like the whole world is against me. I'm constantly stressed and in pain, and I can't seem to catch a break. I've even had to quit my job because of incorrect pay and hours. To make matters worse, my father is sick and I'm struggling to take care of him on my own. Despite all of this, I'm grateful that I'm cancer-free after finding a lump in my breast. But it's hard to focus on the positive when everything else seems to be falling apart. My mother's health is deteriorating, and my oldest brother is dealing with heart problems. To top it all off, my middle brother isn't interested in helping with our family's affairs. I feel overwhelmed and unable to handle life sometimes, and it's hard to shake off the feeling that I'm a failure in every aspect of my life. It's like, no matter how hard I try, everything is just going to fall apart around me."

Event: My mom has fallen into depression due to a choice I made involving who I want to spend my life with, which has hit her hard (girl from different culture).
Post: "My mom's depression is all my fault. I knew my decision would hurt her, but I didn't realize it would be this devastating. I feel like a terrible person for causing her so much pain. It's like everything I do is wrong and I'm destined to make mistakes that hurt the people I love."

Event: ... Failing classes, taking a fall semester off, feeling depressed, isolating oneself, and being made fun of by a competitive friend.
Post: "I'm such a failure. I failed my math test, and now I'm stuck in this rut. I can't seem to do anything right. My date didn't go well either; I guess I'm just doomed to be alone and unsuccessful in everything I do."

Event: You promised to never leave me, yet you left me.
Post: "You promised to never leave me, yet you left me. I'm such a failure in relationships that even my friends and family don't want to be around me anymore."

Event: Feeling worthless and alone after recent breakup, struggling with past traumas and negative self-talk, feeling stuck in life and unable to move forward without help.
Post: "I'm a failure in every relationship I've ever been in. My recent breakup is just further proof that I'm unlovable and will always be alone."

Event: Feeling lonely and depressed due to lack of social interaction and difficulty expressing emotions.
Post: "I feel so isolated and unhappy all the time. I'm just not cut out for this whole socializing thing, and it's affecting every aspect of my life. I'll never be able to connect with people or find true happiness."

Event: My husband was diagnosed with depression and anxiety, he hardly knows life without depression, he's not suicidal or super moody but he's not living life to the fullest either, he's just there, he's been unemployed for few months, he's hoping to get into bookkeeping, luckily they get by just fine on my income alone, I want him to find a career or something fulfilling to do outside of the home, he's not putting in sufficient effort to get a job in a timely manner, he's constantly drained, I'm trying my best to be patient and non-judgmental but I have a hard time telling if it's his own dang fault or depression that he can't help, I fear bringing this up with him too often for fear of making him feel even worse about himself, how do you know or judge what is an acceptable level of functioning and what's unacceptable (and calls for a prescription change, therapy, etc)
Post: "My husband's depression and anxiety have held him back from living his life to the fullest. He's not suicidal or super moody, but he's just going through the motions. Despite my best efforts to be patient and non-judgmental, I can't help but wonder if his lack of effort in finding a job is due to his depression or his own personal failings. It's hard to know what constitutes an acceptable level of functioning when it comes to mental health, and I fear that bringing it up too often will only make him feel worse about himself. It's a delicate balance between being supportive and pushing him to seek help."

Event: Feeling insecure and unhappy about one's appearance and perceived lack of talent or potential for success, as well as feeling isolated and unloved.

Event: Feeling embarrassed and frustrated after failing a driving test.
Post: "I failed my driving test, and it's clear that I'm never going to be able to do anything right. I'm such a failure in every aspect of my life."

Event: Having difficulty eating due to pains and sickness.
Post: "I'm unable to eat due to pains and sickness, which means I'm doomed to be unhealthy and fail at taking care of myself."

Event: A feeling of loneliness and isolation, with no one to talk to and a sense of emptiness and sadness that is affecting the individual's motivation and happiness.

Event:
The individual experienced feelings of sadness, loneliness, and depression, and had a fear of seeking help due to the stigma associated with mental health issues. They also had a difficult childhood experience of being bullied and witnessing their mother's undiagnosed depression.

Conversion: "I know I need help, but in this country, I'm too scared to seek it. I don't want to end up like my mom."
Post:
"I know I need help, but in this country, I'm too scared to seek it. I don't want to end up like my mom."

This post is an example of a Global Attributional Style (GAS) attribution, as the individual is attribute their difficulty seeking help for mental health issues to their childhood experiences of being bullied and witnessing their mother's undiagnosed depression. The post also implies that the individual believes that seeking help for mental health issues is stigmatized in their country, which may be a reflection of their global attributional style.

Event: Feeling lonely and depressed due to a girl being liked, despite always being extroverted with many friends to call and hang out with, feeling bad about one's appearance leading to self-consciousness and fear of rejection when expressing feelings, and struggling to handle the situation at work while still having to interact with the person.
Post: "I can't believe I'm such a failure in love. I've always been outgoing and have plenty of friends, but I just can't seem to connect with the people I truly care about. I feel so ugly and self-conscious, and I'm terrified of rejection. To make things worse, I have to see this person every day at work, and it's a constant reminder of my inadequacy. I don't know how much more of this I can take."

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's feelings of depression, emptiness, and inadequacy, as well as their desire to be happy and their dependence on a particular girl for emotional fulfillment. These events are negative and have a bad effect from the individual's point of view.
Post: "I feel like I'm stuck in a rut and can't seem to escape it. I'm constantly feeling down and empty, like I'm missing something important in my life. I know I need to find happiness, but I feel like I'm never going to achieve it. I keep trying to fill the void with temporary fixes, like this girl I've been obsessing over, but deep down I know it's not the solution. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending cycle of sadness and desperation. I just want to break free and be happy for once."

Event:
The main event in this story is the narrator's relationship with a girl who had a history of being disrespectful, mean, and cynical towards everything. The narrator tried to help her improve her behavior, but she eventually reverted back to her old ways after going back to school. The narrator was emotionally hurt by her behavior and struggled to cope with it, leading to a break-up.

The event can be classified as a negative experience for the narrator, as it caused emotional distress and affected his work, lifestyle, and overall well-being. The event also highlights the importance of mutual respect and empathy in a relationship, as the narrator was unable to get through to the girl despite his best efforts.
Post: "I tried to help her change her ways, but she just couldn't shake off her old habits. It's like, I'm trying to build a house on quicksand. No matter how hard I try, it's never gonna be stable. 🤦‍♂️ I guess that's just the way it is with some people. You can't change them, no matter how much you want to. It's like, they're stuck in their ways and there's nothing you can do about it. 😔 It's a shame, really. I thought we had something special. But I guess I was wrong. 💔"

Event: The main event in this sentence is "I feel like I'm a broken record trying to make you believe what I'm saying, yet the broken pieces are cutting me." This event is described as a negative experience for the speaker, who feels like they are repeatedly trying to convey something to someone else without any success or relief.
Post: "I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of disappointment and frustration. No matter how hard I try, it seems like I'll never be able to get through to you. It's like I'm a broken record, constantly repeating myself without any progress or resolution. And the worst part is, the more I try, the more it feels like I'm cutting myself with every failed attempt. Why can't things just go right for once?"

Event:
I was feeling angry at people for going against what I believed to be my personal and innate way of living, but now I am not sure. Today at school my teacher said "how are you" to me and this girl who had been bothering me for a long time, who I would get angry at but I had never talked to, who seemed to keep smiling at me and looking at me subtly as I would also look at her because I wanted to know what was going on, turned around slightly when she heard that and probably smiled.

Note: The event is the interaction between the writer and their teacher and a girl they had been feeling angry towards.
Post: "I'm starting to question my whole identity. I used to think I was a strong, independent individual, but now I'm not so sure. Today, my teacher asked me how I was doing, and that annoying girl who's always been a thorn in my side smiled at me. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'being myself' thing."

Event: He got back with his second ex who then abused him some more. She would cut if he wouldn't talk to her, laugh at his misfortunes. I was the one he went crying to every damn time.

Event:
My mom killed herself.

Conversion into a more fluent and general expression: The loss of my mother through suicide has had a significant impact on my life.
